channel.title: Nicholas Rees
channel.description: Write your site description here. It will be used as your sites meta description as well!

item.title: Those Important First Decisions
item.description:
Not forgetting those that will inevitably change

Choosing a base visualisation set is more about choosing what not to include than trying to find something to include. There are so many interesting ways to visualise the data we have but only a limited amount of time to get these developed.

The basics, such as the bar, line and column charts but also others that are quirky, radial bars or winding paths to name a few. This is not only about building an informative visualisation for the user, it’s also about making these interesting too.

item.title: It Always Starts With a Blank Canvas
item.description:
Where to Begin

Beginning a new project can be tough, so I’ve decided - hopefully to benefit both myself and anyone reading - to record the process of building a small, reusable and modular infographic library utilising D3.js.

The idea is to build a library that can work like a puzzle, where pieces seamlessly fit on top of one another in such a way that the visuals are neither boring nor repetitive, but will still carry the desired visual identity.

From the outset, It’s important not to be blinded by any seemingly unsurmountable obstacles, which means approaching this in one step at a time.
